title: What are some common examples of external storage devices? - Quora

response.answer_text: At the personal level: USB stick, external USB Hard Disk Drive, CompactFlash card, CD, DVD, and if you want to go old school, floppy disk or Iomega zip drive. For home office/small business: a NAS device from companies like D-Link, Synology, Seagate. Enterprise level: SAN/NAS storage from companies like NetApp, EMC, IBM etc. I’ve got a free ‘Introduction to SAN and NAS’ course you can check out if you want to understand enterprise level storage: Introduction to SAN and NAS Storage HTH

If you have surplus bare hard disk IDE or SATA drives sitting around, IDE to USB or SATA to USB adapters let you use them for external storage very inexpensively, moving the adapter from drive to drive. 3.5″ drives also require an external power supply, a 5v/12v one with 4-pin connector for IDE drives, or a 12v supply with coaxial plug for SATA drives. Some 2.5″ drives draw more than the 500ma supplied by a single USB port. In this case, a Y adapter with two male and one female connector doubles available current supply.
